results.title: Cavity walls
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Brickwork”.
One of a series of eight films which gives a complete basic training in building construction with reference to brickwork. The purpose of cavity construction is explained and the methods employed are demonstrated. Treatment at the foot, damp-proof course, ties, prevention of fill-in of cavity by mortar droppings, installation of ventilation, cross walls, sealing off of window and door openings at sills and heads, fixing of joists and sealing of top of wall at the all plate.

results.title: Caverns and geysers
results.brief_description: Illustrates how underground water is constantly changing our earth. We see the results of its action in limestone regions where underground water has dissolved out large caverns. In a few areas we see spectacular hot springs and geysers, created when volcanic rock heats water under the ground. Filmed with the co-operation of Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Sequoia National Park and Yellowstone National Park.

results.title: Caveboy meets Future Boy
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
An animated short of a caveboy who gets killed by hunters and gets transmitted into a future world of violence and war. Robots are evil in this world and caveboy is saved from attack by Future Boy. They come together and escape from this world of fear by being teleported into another future dimension.

results.title: Cave temples of India
results.creator_credit: Jagat Murari, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A vivid reminder of a great past when people created miracles in stone to express devotion to their gods. Shows some of the famous rock-cut shrines, including the caves at Badami, Elephanta and Ellora, dating from the 17th century. Explains the statues depicting the various incarnations of the Hindu deity. Commentary by Berkeley Hill.

results.title: Cave man
results.brief_description: Animated cartoon featuring Willie Whopper. While paying a visit to the Natural History Museum, Willie relates a tall tale about how he saved his girlfriend Mary from a dinosaur.

results.title: Cavalcade of Australia
results.brief_description: On the celebration of Australia’s Jubilee as a Commonwealth, Australian film production organisations, both government and commercial, made available for this film archival material from their libraries. The film shows highlights of the important events of the first 50 years of the Federation. Music by Sydney John Kay.

results.title: Caulking compounds
results.brief_description: Describes the properties and proper use of caulking compounds as joining materials in modern building construction.

results.title: Caught shoplifting
results.brief_description: Explores and illustrates the economic issues as well as the human motivations behind the act of shoplifting: the desire for adventure; plain boredom; a feeling of alienation or a need to conform. The film does more than direct attention to the scope and social consequences of shoplifting. It focuses on the greatest need to examine our individual understanding of ethics and morality, and to avoid the near occasions of self-indulgence in theft.

results.title: Caught in the net
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Still Water Pictures, Nathan Neumer, Lori Roth and David Tennant
results.brief_description: A thought provoking short documentary about exercising caution when developing friendships over the Internet and for the level of information that is disclosed. It does this through a discussion between two friends who have met and become friends in real life. This is compared to the relationship that is developing between one of them and someone he has ‘met’ over the Internet in a discussion room and via email. It questions issues such as what information is volunteered, what is held back, intuition, and whose on the other end of this unknown and faceless form of communication.
